lg.l: where the sea circles arounf the island in a star pattern - where in
the center of grieving er are disoriented, skinless - where i wade
into the field...the scent of sun on wheat - where the horses
bow in & out, kick up a hoof, satisfied, perhaps, in their available
bodies - where I've located a tiny refuge : the horizontal view
from the house on stilts - where we hide the part of us that
shudders, wihtout a script - where we grief, even our own stories
feel vacant - where you hear yourself telling the story & at the
same time you think that's not it, that's really not it - where the
ice plants grow in a translucent bandsge across the cliff face -
where impermanence is the direct expression of emptiness &
emptiness is the best description of reality - where you wake from
sleep to someone leaving, but only the drape of their scarf
across their back - if grief is a shining fruit
